Articles.Content:
Yes. I did.

How did you get 170 points (before dividing by 20)? Show your work

9.8

Think only thing I didn't get points for is playing with RSS. I intend to.. just seems kinda like a hassle to get it all installed and learn the different things/ fuels etc, or am i confusing RSS with realism overhaul... i think i am.. Anyways, Havn't played with either.

To add another challenge to your questionare, Probably one of the things i found most challenging and rewarding in stock moreso than successful 6man eve ascent vehicle lagfest pre sls parts, was stranding jeb into a 250x250km orbit around kerbol and rescuing him.. XD But Idk how many people have tried such a thing..

If you havn't, give it a shot

Edited October 1, 2014 by Nedal

I'd recommend that you change your rating system a bit. Each poll option is currently connected to the one before it (0-2, 2-4, 4-6 etc.), and while your rules explain how it's supposed to be answered, it still looks pretty bad. It would be better to arrange them like this: 0-2, 3-5, 6-8, and so on.

Q: Have you ever achieved a stable orbit around Kerbin?(2 points) yes (2p)

Q: Have you ever landed and returned from the Mun?(4 points) yes (4p)

Q: Have you ever landed and returned from Minmus?(4 points) yes (4p)

Q: On how many objects outside the Kerbin system(which includes Kerbin, the Mun and Minmus) have you landed on(doesn't have to be a return mission)(2 points per object, or 24 if you've landed on all)

Everything expect Eeloo, (22p)

Q: Have you ever successfully docked?(10 points) Yes, (10p)

Q: Have you ever intercepted an asteroid?(16 points) Yes, (16p)

Optional question 1(if you use mods): How many of the following difficulty enhancing mods: TAC life support, Remote Tech, Deadly Reentry, FAR, RSS; have you used at the same time in a save?(4 points per mod) I tried an modded game with FAR, Deadly Reentry and Tac, but usually I use stock (0p)

Optional question 2(if you don't use mods): Do you rarely(in less than half of your career saves) use reverts/reloads? If only your revertless/reloadless worlds were counted, would the amount of 'yes' answers to the above questions be roughly the same?(+0.25 points for every 'yes' answer to the above questions that would remain the same, not including optional question 1) I used to use reloads and reverts, but I think I have achieved orbit , returned from mun and minmus and docked at orbit in my new no reloads/reverts save (1p)

Q: On which of the following objects outside the Kerbin system have you done successful return missions: Duna(2.5 points), Ike(2.5 points), Dres(5 points), Moho(5 points), Gilly(5 points), Laythe(10 points), Vall(10 points), Bop(10 points), Pol(10 points), Tylo(15 points), Eeloo(15 points), Eve(30 points)

Only places I have not returned from are Eeloo and Tylo (90p) (why is Moho only 5p? It is much harder than gilly or bop/pol)

(149p/20 = 7.45p)

Edited October 1, 2014 by Joonatan1998
1.4? But that can't be right...

Where's the button for 11?

(ok, 202 / 20 = 10+small change)

Score of ~4.6

Nope, that's gonna be my next mission though.

If only your revertless/reloadless worlds were counted, would the amount of 'yes' answers to the above questions be roughly the same?(+0.25 points for every 'yes' answer to the above questions that would remain the same, not including optional question 1)

I use reverts. Very, very, frequently. (no)

Q: On which of the following objects outside the Kerbin system have you done successful return missions: Duna(2.5 points), Ike(2.5 points), Dres(5 points), Moho(5 points), Gilly(5 points), Laythe(10 points), Vall(10 points), Bop(10 points), Pol(10 points), Tylo(15 points), Eeloo(15 points), Eve(30 points)

I have a spaceship orbiting around duna that can easily get back with more than enough delta-v, that landed on duna and ike, but it hasn't come back yet, so that doesn't count.

All told, a score of 1.2, but mainly because I tend to stick inside the kerbin system. (I don't really like going interplanetary, everything has to be just right before I even consider finally sending my ship out)

Woo I did an Eve return (all stock parts), for the express purpose of padding out my score (I noticed it didn't say anything about 'manned' so sent an octo2 to the surface and brought it back)~

Update to my original score:

200 -4 (have used all difficulty mods together in the same save EXCEPT full-scale RSS) = 196/20 = 9.8~

Q: Have you ever achieved a stable orbit around Kerbin?(2 points)

yup

Q: Have you ever landed and returned from the Mun?(4 points)

Yup

Q: Have you ever landed and returned from Minmus?(4 points)

Q: On how many objects outside the Kerbin system(which includes Kerbin, the Mun and Minmus) have you landed on(doesn't have to be a return mission)(2 points per object, or 24 if you've landed on all)

Eve, Duna, Ike, and Dres.

Q: Have you ever successfully docked?(10 points)

Yup

Q: Have you ever intercepted an asteroid?(16 points)

Nope

Optional question 1(if you use mods): How many of the following difficulty enhancing mods: TAC life support, Remote Tech, Deadly Reentry, FAR, RSS; have you used at the same time in a save?(4 points per mod)

Remote Tech, DRE, FAR, RSS

Q: On which of the following objects outside the Kerbin system have you done successful return missions: Duna(2.5 points), Ike(2.5 points), Dres(5 points), Moho(5 points), Gilly(5 points), Laythe(10 points), Vall(10 points), Bop(10 points), Pol(10 points), Tylo(15 points), Eeloo(15 points), Eve(30 points)

Duna, and Dres (Eve, Ike and Gilly as well, if you don't count landings)

That gives me 51.5/20 = 2.5-ish

I'd count myself as a reasonably skilled player though. Once you go interplanetary once, it's just a matter of adding more delta-V. It's less a matter of having more skill, more a matter of having the patience to mount a refuelling mission so you have the delta-V to get to Moho or Jool.

I also play with the ISP difficulty scaler at the moment, so I actually need a Saturn V to get to the Mun. Any longer trips need orbital assembly

Essentially, I have more fun playing around near Kerbin, building various aircraft, roleplaying Apollo, Gemini, Mir, the ISS, building bases, practising landing, than I do on long interplanetary drags, although I still fully intend to send something more than a flyby probe to Jool one of these days!

If only your revertless/reloadless worlds were counted, would the amount of 'yes' answers to the above questions be roughly the same?(+0.25 points for every 'yes' answer to the above questions that would remain the same, not including optional question 1) (This question confuses me. Do I still answer this if I don't use the difficulty increasing mods, but DO use mods in general? o_O Anyway, I don't revert or reload, unless a bug kills my ship. )

Q: On which of the following objects outside the Kerbin system have you done successful return missions: Duna, Laythe

That would make 48.5/20 = 2,425 (even if I get any points from optional 2 that won't change much)

Q: Have you ever achieved a stable orbit around Kerbin?(2 points)

Q: Have you ever landed and returned from the Mun?(4 points)

Q: Have you ever landed and returned from Minmus?(4 points)

Yes all, 10 p.

Q: On how many objects outside the Kerbin system(which includes Kerbin, the Mun and Minmus) have you landed on(doesn't have to be a return mission)(2 points per object, or 24 if you've landed on all)

What is accepted to landing on Jool and Kerbol? Vessel explodes as it touches Jool or Kerbol at very slow speed. I have made such a landing to Jool and hit Kerbol's crashig surface at high speed. But in any case, I have landed to more than 12 bodies and get maximum points 24 p (total 34).

Q: Have you ever successfully docked?(10 points)

Q: Have you ever intercepted an asteroid?(16 points)

Yes both, 26 p (total 50 p).

Optional question 1(if you use mods): How many of the following difficulty enhancing mods: TAC life support, Remote Tech, Deadly Reentry, FAR, RSS; have you used at the same time in a save?(4 points per mod)

I use regularily TAC life support and Deadly Re-entry. I tested also FAR, but uninstalled that because I did not want to assemble huge things on orbit. 8p (tot 58).

Optional question 2(if you don't use mods): Do you rarely(in less than half of your career saves) use reverts/reloads? If only your revertless/reloadless worlds were counted, would the amount of 'yes' answers to the above questions be roughly the same?(+0.25 points for every 'yes' answer to the above questions that would remain the same, not including optional question 1)

I use reloading and reverts. I do not want such a game that every minor oblivion costs hours of work. Especially because I have typically much of disturbances from family members which increases probability of forgetting things. This is game and entertainment. But If I lose something because I make an mistake (for example a piloting error) then I accept situation. 0p.

Q: On which of the following objects outside the Kerbin system have you done successful return missions: Duna(2.5 points), Ike(2.5 points), Dres(5 points), Moho(5 points), Gilly(5 points), Laythe(10 points), Vall(10 points), Bop(10 points), Pol(10 points), Tylo(15 points), Eeloo(15 points), Eve(30 points)

All of mentioned. 120 p (total 178).

What is accepted to landing on Jool and Kerbol? Vessel explodes as it touches Jool or Kerbol at very slow speed. I have made such a landing to Jool and hit Kerbol's crashig surface at high speed. But in any case, I have landed to more than 12 bodies and get maximum points 24 p (total 34).

The question does not include Jool and the Sun. Moho, Eve, Gilly, Duna, Ike, Dres, Laythe, Tylo, Vall, Pol, Bop, and Eeloo are 12 bodies. You are not supposed to count Kerbin, Mun, Minmus, Sun, or Jool.

IMO, this might actually be too hard for the beginner. Take, for example, someone who just landed on the Mun and Minmus and orbited Kerbin. That isn't really a newbie, but on this poll they would be catastrophic.

On the other hand it gives those of us who are starting to think we're getting the hang of it a swift reality calibration... I scored 1 (Orbit, Mun, Minimus and docking)

I think the thing is, it's not really a quiz of skill. If you can land on Moho, you can pretty much land anywhere, Pol, Bop, Gilly, even Tylo shouldn't be worth extra points just because you haven't done them yet.

It would probably be more useful if there was an ascending order of difficulty for things. Say orbit Kerbin->Safely return to Kerbin->Orbit Mun->Land on Mun->Return Kerbal from Mun->...->Return from Surface of Tylo->Return from Surface of Eve. You only get points for the most "difficult" thing in each category you have done.

I reckon I currently score 1.6 (Kerbin system, docking, been to Duna and back, landed on some other bodies but not returned).

This will leap up to 4.7 once my ongoing Jool-5 mission is complete and safely returned to Kerbin.

Q: Have you ever achieved a stable orbit around Kerbin?(2 points)

Yes.

Q: Have you ever landed and returned from the Mun?(4 points)

Yes.

Q: Have you ever landed and returned from Minmus?(4 points)

Yes.

Q: On how many objects outside the Kerbin system(which includes Kerbin, the Mun and Minmus) have you landed on(doesn't have to be a return mission)(2 points per object, or 24 if you've landed on all)

I've landed on all of them.

Q: Have you ever successfully docked?(10 points)

Yes, routinely now.

Q: Have you ever intercepted an asteroid?(16 points)

Yes, once just after the ARM update came out. Haven't tried ever since.

Optional question 1(if you use mods): How many of the following difficulty enhancing mods: TAC life support, Remote Tech, Deadly Reentry, FAR, RSS; have you used at the same time in a save?(4 points per mod)

I don't use any of these difficulty-enhancing mods. I only use aesthetics-enhancing mods as well as MechJeb (no autopilots though, just a lot of info screens), Kerbal Alarm Clock (must have!) and Docking Port Alignment Indicator (I learned to dock proficiently before installing it, but it's just so cool to use).

Optional question 2(if you don't use mods): Do you rarely(in less than half of your career saves) use reverts/reloads? If only your revertless/reloadless worlds were counted, would the amount of 'yes' answers to the above questions be roughly the same?(+0.25 points for every 'yes' answer to the above questions that would remain the same, not including optional question 1)

I do quicksave like a maniac and I've quickloaded quite a few times, but I think more than half of my landings / maneuvers were done on the first try (so it's mainly paranoia). Still, i'll take zero points here to be fair. I'll have to try a non-quickload save after 0.25 goes out, and see how well I fare.

Q: On which of the following objects outside the Kerbin system have you done successful return missions: Duna(2.5 points), Ike(2.5 points), Dres(5 points), Moho(5 points), Gilly(5 points), Laythe(10 points), Vall(10 points), Bop(10 points), Pol(10 points), Tylo(15 points), Eeloo(15 points), Eve(30 points)

All of them, including manned return missions to Moho, Tylo and Eve.

Score : 2 + 4 + 4 + 24 + 10 + 16 + 0 + 0 + 2.5 + 2.5 + 5 + 5 + 5 +10 +10 + 10 + 10 + 15 + 15 + 30 = 180

Final Score : 180 / 20 = 9.0

Edited October 3, 2014 by Meithan

Q: On which of the following objects outside the Kerbin system have you done successful return missions: Duna(2.5 points), Ike(2.5 points), Dres(5 points), Moho(5 points), Gilly(5 points), Laythe(10 points), Vall(10 points), Bop(10 points), Pol(10 points), Tylo(15 points), Eeloo(15 points), Eve(30 points)

Was about to start complaining about the score, too, then i got the "/20" part

I noticed however that your difficulty level scoring seems to prefer quanity over quality, i would say if you can do EvE land/return you can do basically anything, so this maybe is more about "how far along are you on the completion-chart"?
I've done pretty much everything there is to do both in vanilla and heavily modded KSP. Too lazy to count though. Voted 8-10.
